column1: U.S. Army targets saving billions of dollars in processing costs with new forms automation solution from IBM
column2: Enterprise Information Management provides program and technical analysis and develops return on investment plan.
Hear what IBM is doing with SaaS with these podcasts from Dave Mitchell, program director for Software as a Service, and Rado Nikolov, director of emerging business.
This workshop provides training on IBM DB2 Version 9.5 for Linux, UNIX, and Windows.

column1: Podcast: February 2008 SOA community update from John Gordon
column2: John Gordon, IBM director of WebSphere and SOA channels, describes four exciting announcements to help you focus and drive your business as part of the SOA Business Partner Community. ( Transcript , Slides )

column1: Compwise gains strong lead, collaborates on joint project with IBM Russia
column2: Compwise finds that the IBM Business Partner Application Showcase gives them the visibility they need to broaden their market.

column1: IBM and Learn.com speed training and career development for employees of rapidly growing home health services company
column2: When a home health services company doubles its employee population, it must effectively train the new employees and efficiently manage continued growth. Read about this Software as a Service (SaaS) success story and more.

column1: Quixtar, a leading online retailer, deploys solution that supports 24 x 7 operations and enables planned maintenance
column2: Solution from IBM and Vision Solutions helps Quixtar meet its recovery time objective of two hours or less in the event of an outage.

column1: Christopher Wong: Lotus for IBM Business Partners: Communicate. Collaborate. Innovate.
column2: Recently, I had the chance to attend Lotusphere in Orlando, Florida. Over 7,000 clients and IBM Business Partners were the first to learn about some amazing new products and enhancements, and you should have heard the buzz!

column1: IBM Innovation Centers for Business Partners open in Denmark, Finland, and Norway
column2: Located with the IBM Forums, these centers offer you assistance from building to marketing and selling your solutions.
Build skills that deliver effective customer presentations and demonstrations, and perform an installation and simple configuration.
